title: Aristotle said 'happiness is the highest good', would you refute him? - Quora

response.answer_text: No, but the Bible would. As the Bible says, “money answers to all things”. Anything this world has to offer, will honor wealth, but money cannot buy happiness, many multi millionaires could attest to that. On the other hand, contentment, or happiness earned, is great gain, and that by looking to the needs of others and not to just oneself. I might add happiness in itself is the result, that came about, and only then by good.
